description: A friend of Charles Sanders Peirce, Francis Ellingwood Abbot (November 6, 1836 – October 23, 1903) was an American philosopher and theologian who sought to reconstruct theology in accord with scientific method. The lifelong romance between himself and his wife forms the subject of If Ever Two Were One, a collection of his correspondence and diary entries. He had one child named 'Nahalum', it is only a nickname. It comes from an Indian word which means that the talent is hereditary. It is believed that his son, Nahalum will take his place at a stage.
name: Francis Ellingwood Abbot
